description: Construct a triangle as in A036262. Sequence is one less than the position of the first number larger than 2 in the n-th row (n-th difference).
references: W. Sierpiński, A Selection of Problems in the Theory of Numbers. Macmillan, NY, 1964, p. 35.
N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..274
R. B. Killgrove and K. E. Ralston, On a conjecture concerning the primes, Math. Comp., 13 (1959), 121-122.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Gilbreath's Conjecture
Index entries for primes, gaps between
mathematica: max = 10^4; triangle = NestList[Abs[Differences[#]] &, Prime[Range[max]], max]; a[n_] := (p = Position[triangle[[n + 1]], k_ /; k > 2, 1, 1]; If[p == {}, Nothing, p[[1, 1]] - 1]); Table[a[n], {n, 1, Sqrt[max]}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 06 2016 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: Edited by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 18 2002
